intro: Philibertia lysimachioides, commonly known as the blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It has a compact, low-growing habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are tubular and attract pollinators like bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
